title: Coronica moralizada del orden de San Augustin en / el Peru con sucesos egenplares en esta Monarquia [...]
information: De la Calancha tells of the destruction of the indigenous people of Anco Anco, who were scorched by fire and swallowed by the earth (pp. 513-517). The phenomenon narrated was explained by José de Acosta in 1590 (Historia natural y moral de las Indias) as the result of an earthquake. De la Calancha adds a moralising dimension to the narrative: the Indians were victims of God's punishment as sodomites and idolaters.

title: Cronica de la provincia peruana de la orden de los ermitaños de San / Agustin Nuestro Padre [...]
information: A p. 501, Torres refers to the impossibility of evangelising the Indians of the Anco Anco settlement. This forced Father Contreras to leave the doctrine in the hands of the bishop in 1567, and subsequently justified the divine punishment: the earth opened up and swallowed the village. In this way, Torres continues the moralising explanation of the disappearance of the village already applied by Father Antonio de la Calancha, the Augustinian chronicler who preceded him. In fact, Torres recalls that Maestro Calancha had already explained the event in detail. Previously, the Jesuit José de Acosta had attributed the disappearance of the Anco Anco village to an earthquake in 1581.

The idolatrous and sorcerous Indians would have been punished for their refusal to convert, so the event should act as a reminder to stop their vices.

title: Coronica de la religiosissima provincia de los doze apostoles del Peru, de la orden de N.P. S. Francisco  de la regular observancia [...]
information: It generally takes up the information provided by José de Acosta in Historia Natural y Moral de las Indias (1590), although there are some additions and absences.  It recounts the loud warning noise that occurred before the earthquake that alerted people. Few people died even though the earthquake also caused a tsunami, as happened in Chile. On this occasion, Lima decided to name the Visitation of the Virgin to her cousin Saint Isabel as patron saint. From then on, a mass, sermon and procession take place every year on 2 July.
summary: It generally takes up the information provided by José de Acosta in Historia Natural y Moral de las Indias (1590), although there are some additions and absences.  It recounts the loud warning noise that occurred before the earthquake that alerted people. Few people died even though the earthquake also caused a tsunami, as happened in Chile. On this occasion, Lima decided to name the Visitation of the Virgin to her cousin Saint Isabel as patron saint. From then on, a mass, sermon and procession take place every year on 2 July.

title: Cronica de la / provincia peruana de la orden de los ermitaños de San Agustin Nuestro Padre [...]
information: The description of the eruption of Huaynaputina occupies pages 73-80 of the Augustinian work. Torres attributes the eruption to the sins of Arequipa and recalls that already in the past the inhabitants had suffered the wrath of God with the earthquake of 1587. He reflects on the causes of the event, which, having occurred during the rainy season, should have led him to believe that the cause was not natural but divine. He also mentions how some preachers, such as the Jesuit Alonso Ruiz, had prophesied God's imminent punishment. On the disaster, he says he consulted the texts of the Jesuit Martín del Río, Juan Solórzano Pereira and Antonio de la Calancha. The author describes the phases of the calamity and how the noise generated by the eruption was mistaken by the viceroy for a naval battle with English pirates. Of particular note is the definition of Huaynaputina as an Indian Vesuvius'. The work of the Society of Jesus and the Augustinians in assisting the population is particularly noteworthy.'
summary: The description of the eruption of Huaynaputina occupies pages 73-80 of the Augustinian work. Torres attributes the eruption to the sins of Arequipa and recalls that already in the past the inhabitants had suffered the wrath of God with the earthquake of 1587. He reflects on the causes of the event, which, having occurred during the rainy season, should have led him to believe that the cause was not natural but divine. title: Coronica de la religiosissima provincia de los doze apostoles del Peru, de la orden de N.P. S. Francisco  de la regular observancia [...]
information: Diego de Córdoba y Salinas notes the premonitory preaching of Francisco Solano in Trujillo 15 years before the catastrophe and the announcement of the earthquake by San Valentín to the abbess of the convent of Santa Clara. He also describes the destruction of the monastery of Santa María La Gracia La Real, belonging to the order of Santa Clara, and the general effects of the earthquake, which caused 350 deaths. He also refers to the aftershocks, which were stronger than the first earthquake, and to the emotions that the disaster generated in the population.

title: Coronica moralizada del orden de San Augustin en el Peru con sucesos egenplares en esta Monarqvia [...]
information: The friar, who witnessed the earthquake, refers to the comet of December 1618 that would have announced the tremor (pp. 488-489). He recounts the effects of the earthquake on the topography, the sea and the buildings of the city. According to De La Calancha, it caused 350 deaths (p. 489). He praises the action of the Augustinians in contrast to other religious orders who decided to leave the city (pp. 489-490). The poor decided to appoint De La Calancha as their representative to prevent the city from being moved. De La Calancha claims that he succeeded in his mission despite having the viceroy and the Audiencias against him (pp. 498-499). De La Calancha also refers to a prodigy that occurred after the earthquake, but denies the disastrous consequences attributed to it by the population (p. 490). The Augustinian friar also narrates the salvation of the painter Leonardo de Jaramillo (pp. 493-494) and the transfer of the temple of the Virgin of Guadalupe and her image because of the earthquake (pp. 566-567).
summary: The friar, who witnessed the earthquake, refers to the comet of December 1618 that would have announced the tremor (pp. 488-489). information: In the epitome of the first volume, page 10,  the friar says that the earthquake ruined the Augustinian convent of the city which, according to the author, became one of the most distinguished convent of regulars in the kingdom of Peru. He states that at the time of writing the convent has already been repaired and has become one of the good convents of the province.

title: Coronica de la religiosissima provincia de los doze / apostoles del Peru, de la orden de N.P. S. Francisco  de la regular / observancia [...]
information: Diego de Córdoba y Salinas witnessed the earthquake that took place at 12 a.m. He refers the miracle of Nuestra Señora del Milagro's image, located in the main chapel of the Franciscan convent in Lima. The image appeared with jointed hands in prayer as if asking for forgiveness and mercy for the city. Moreover, one day when the religious were praying to the Virgin, they saw the image turn and smile at them. The friar tells about the damages that the earthquake caused to the cathedral. The only intercession of the Virgin managed to avoid the complete destruction of Lima.
summary: Diego de Córdoba y Salinas witnessed the earthquake that took place at 12 a.m. He refers the miracle of Nuestra Señora del Milagro's image, located in the main chapel of the Franciscan convent in Lima. The image appeared with jointed hands in prayer as if asking for forgiveness and mercy for the city. Moreover, one day when the religious were praying to the Virgin, they saw the image turn and smile at them. The friar tells about the damages that the earthquake caused to the cathedral. The only intercession of the Virgin managed to avoid the complete destruction of Lima.
author: Córdoba y Salinas, Diego de

Con una verissima relatione di quanto è successo da detto dì fino a 22 di gennaro 1632. Dedicato all’illustrissimo signor Alessandro Felice Rovito, duca di Castel Saracino
author: Amodio, Giulio

title: Decima relatione, nella quale più delle altre si dà breve e soccinto raguaglio dell’incendio risvegliato nel monte Vesuvio o di Somma nell’anno 1631 alli 16 di decembre sino alli 8 di gennaro del presente anno 1632. Data in luce per Vincenzo Bove
author: Unknown

title: Dell’incendio del Monte di Somma. Compita relatione, e di quanto è succeduto insino ad hoggi. Publicata per Giovanni Orlandi romano alla Pietà
author: [Orlandi, Giovanni]

title: Dell’incendio del Monte di Somma. Compita relatione, e di quanto è successo insino ad hoggi. Publicata per Giovanni Orlandi romano alla Pietà
author: Orlandi, Giovanni

title: Dell’incendio fattosi nel Vesuvio a XVI di dicembre MDCXXXI e delle sue cause ed effetti. Con la narrazione di quanto è seguito in esso per tutto marzo 1632, e con la storia di tutti gli altri incendii nel medesimo monte avvenuti. Discorrendosi infine delle acque, le quali in questa occasione hanno danneggiato le campagne, e di molte altre cose curiose. Dell’abbate Giulio Cesare Braccini, da Gioviano di Lucca, dottor di leggi e protonotario appostolico
author: Braccini, Giulio Cesare

title: Descrittione dell’incendio del monte Vesuvio e suoi maravigliosi effetti, principiato la notte delli 15 di decembre MDCXXXI. Composta per il R.P.M. Ludovico Tregliotta da Castellana, dell’ordine de’ minori conventuali
notes: Frontespizio con marca tipografica: calderone con all'interno fuoco purificatore, sormontato da un cartiglio col motto Donec purum'
author: Tregliotta, Ludovico

title: Il Vesuvio ardente. Di Giovanni Apolloni all’illustrissimo signor conte Mario Carpegna
author: Apolloni, Giovanni

title: Discorsi della natura, accidenti e pronostici dell’incendio del Monte di Somma dell’anno 1631. Del dottor Antonio Santorelli, primo lettore di medicina e filosofia nella scola di Napoli. Posti in luce da Marcaurelio Ciampotto e dedicati all’illustrissimo signor don Giego De Mendozza
author: Santorelli, Antonio

title: Discorso aristotelico intorno al terremoto nuovamente occorso nella fedelissima città di Nap. alli 16 del mese di decembre 1631, nel quale si dimostra la vera causa di questo terremoto con il secreto per provedere acciò ne' tempi avvenire non caggioni altre rovine. Per il R.D. Pietro Asterio, sacerdote della Congregatione de padri pii operarii
author: Asterio, Pietro

title: Discorso astrononico sopra li quattro ecclissi del 1632 e uno del 1633. Di D. Angelo Perrotti. Con la risolutione di trenta quesiti. All’illustriss. et eccellentiss. sig. D. Andrea Gonzaga
notes: Contiene anche un Discorso filosofico di padre Zaccaria, abate di s. Severino
author: Perrotti, Angelo

title: Discorso filosofico et astrologico di D. Donato da Siderno, abbate celestino, nel quale si mostra quanto sia corroso il monte Vesuvio dal suo primo incendio sino al presente e quanto habbi da durare detto incendio. All’illustrissimo et eccellentiss.mo sig. il signor conte di Monterei, del Conseglio Segreto di Sua M. e viceré di Napoli
author: da Siderno, Donato

title: Discorso naturale delle cause et effetti causati nell’incendio del monte Vesevo, con relatione del tutto. Di Scipione Falcone, spetial di medicina, napolitano
author: Falcone, Scipione

title: Discorso sopra l’origine de’ fuochi gettati dal monte Vesevo, ceneri piovute, et altri simili successi e pronostico d’effetti maggiori. Di Gio. Francesco Porrata Spinola galateo, medico, filosofo e astrologo eccellentissimo, al signor Vincenzo Sirigatti, gentilhuomo fiorentino
author: Porrata Spinola, Giovan Francesco

title: Distinta relatione dell’incendio del sevo Vesuvio alli 16 di decembre 1631 successo. Con la relatione del incendio della città di Pozzuoli e cause delli terremoti al tempo di Don Pedro de Toledo, viceré in questo Regno nell’anno 1534. Dedicata all’eminentissimo e reverendissimo signore, il signor cardinale Gio. Domenico Spinula, arcivescovo dell’Acerenza e Matera
author: Masini, Michelangelo

title: Due relationi compite del maraviglioso et horribil caso de terremoti, fiocca di cenere e incendio del Monte di Somma, detto Vesuvio. Sommariamente descritta e estratta da diverse lettere di religiosi e particolari venuti da Napoli, con la nota di quante volte è successo ne’ tempi antichi e una breve dichiarazione di quello che significa
notes: The relazione by Antonio Gerardi is dedicated to Tegrimio Tegrimi. The relazione by Giovanni Gianetti is dedicated to Paolo Girolamo Pallavicino
author: Gerardi, Antonio; Gianetti, Giovanni

title: Gli terrori del titubante Vesuvio. Del dottor Biase Antonio delli Falconi
author: Delli Falconi, Biase Antonio

author: Garsia, Giovan Andrea

title: Il lagrimevole avvenimento dell’incendio del monte Vesuvio per la città di Napoli e luoghi adiacenti, nel qual si narra minutamente tutti i successi fino al presente giorno. Del Capradosso agostiniano
author: Agostiniano, Capradosso

title: Il lagrimevole avvenimento dell’incendio del monte Vesuvio per la città di Napoli e luoghi adiacenti, nel qual si narra minutamente tutti i successi fino al presente giorno. Del Capradosso
author: Agostiniano, Capradosso

title: Il lagrimevole avvenimento dell’incendio del monte Vesuvio per la città di Napoli e luoghi adiacenti, nel qual si narra minutamente tutti i successi sino al presente giorno. Del Capradosso
author: Agostiniano, Capradosso

title: Il maraviglioso e tremendo incendio del monte Vesuvio, detto a Napoli la montagna di Somma nel 1631, ove si raccontano distintamente tutte l’attioni e successi in detto monte, suoi luochi adiacenti e a Napoli, con un discorso metheorologico o filosofico dell’effetti naturali che possono haver cagionato questo incendio, notandosi la causa materiale, efficiente e finale. Del M.R.P frat’Angelo De Eugenii da Perugia, dottor theologo franciscano
author: De Eugenii, Angelo

title: Il Vesuvio acceso. Descritto da Vincenzo Bove per l’illustrissimo signore Gio. Battista Velenzuela Velazquez, primo regente per la Maestà Cath. nel Conseg. Supremo d’Italia
author: Bove, Vincenzo

title: Incendio del monte Vesuvio. Di Pietro Castelli romano, lettore nello Studio di Roma già di Filosofia e ora di Medicina, nel quale si tratta di tutti gli luoghi ardenti, delle differenze delli fuoghi, loro segni, cagioni, prognostici e rimedii, con metodo distinto, historico e filosofico. Con la giunta d’alcuni quesiti circa lo stato presente del Vesuvio e le loro esplicationi e annotationi
notes: stemma del cardinale Lelio Biscia (che si ripete a p. 74); dello stesso autore (da consultare): Flagello della peste del dottor d. Pietro Castello romano, … 	In Messina : per gli heredi di Pietro Brea, 1656: http://id.sbn.it/bid/PALE000271
author: Castelli, Pietro

title: Incendio del Visuvio. Del Lanelfi
author: [Finella, Filippo]

title: L’incendii del monte Vesuvio, e delle straggi e rovine che ha fatto ne’ tempi antichi e moderni insino a 3 di marzo 1632. Di D. Gioseffo Mormile napolitano
author: Mormile, Giuseppe

title: L’incendio del monte Vesuvio. Di Francesco Bernaudo al santissimo martire Gianuario. Diviso in due parti: nella prima si discorre degli effetti del detto incendio in cap. XX; nella seconda delle cagioni in cap. XXVIII. Con dimostrarsi il tempo che durerà il detto incendio, i rimedii che vi sarebbono per estinguerlo, i futuri mali che ne predice, e altre cose curiosissime come dal racconto de’ capitoli nella seguente facciata appare
author: Bernaudo, Francesco

title: L’opre stupende e maravigliosi eccessi dalla natura prodotti nel monte Vesuvio della città di Napoli, liberata per intercessione della beatissima Vergine e de’ gloriosi santi Gennaro, Tomaso e altri protettori. Con la narratione de tutti i danni occorsi così ne’ paesi convicini del monte come lontani, e delle terre destrutte, e de casi successi così in questa come nell’altre volte che è succeduto l’incendio presente, e del gran frutto cavato per l’anime dal zelo de prencipi ecclesiastici e secolari, del governo e opra de religiosi della città di Napoli. Raccolte dal sig. Francesco Ceraso per il corso di cinquantasei giorni dell’incendio, all’illustrissimo signore don Pietro Giordano Orsino, dignissimo preside del Sac. Reg. Cons. e protonotario del Regno di Napoli meritissimo
author: Ceraso, Francesco

title: La cinquantesima e bellissima relatione del monte Vesuvio in stile accademico. Stampata alli quindici di marzo MDCXXXII. Al molto illustre signore e padron mio osservandissimo il signor Rafaelle Ruscelai, Giovanni Orlandi D.D.D.
author: Unknown

title: La crudelissima guerra, danni e minaccie del superbo campione Vesuvio. title: La seconda parte delli avisi. Del revederendo padre Pontano hibernese, habitante nella Croce di Palazzo. Di tutto quello ch’è successo in tutta la seconda settimana, e così l’avrete d’ogni sette in sette giorni. Ottavio Beltrano la dedica e dona al medesimo padre

notes: Frontespizio con marca tipografica: calderone con all'interno fuoco purificatore, sormontato da un cartiglio col motto Donec purum'

author: Rocco, Ascanio

title: Vera relatione del crudele, misero e lacrimoso prodigio successo nel monte Vesuvio, circa otto miglia distante dalla nobilissima e delittiosissima città di Partenope, detta Napoli, nella quale brevemente s’esprime quante terre siano per tal’effetto distrutte, quant’hanno patito notabil danno e quante genti siano ivi morte. Con breve descrittione anco quante volte sia successo nei tempi antichi

title: Vera relatione del miserabile e memorabile caso, successo nella falda della nominatissima montagna di Somma, altrimente detto Mons Vesuvii, circa sei miglia distante dalla nobilissima e gentilissima città di Napoli, dal martedì alli 16. del mese di decembre 1631. sino al seguente martedì 23 dell’istesso mese, giorno per giorno, e hora per hora distintamente descritta. Durch den Ehrwurdigen P. Fr. Jacobum Milesium
author: Milesio, Giacomo

title: Récit véritable du misérable et mémorable accident arrivé en la descente de la très renommée montagne de Somma, autrement le Vésuve, environ trois lieues loing de la ville de Naples, depuis le lundi 15 décembre 1631 sur les 9 heures du soir jusques au mardi suivant 23 du mesme. Regno e patria di Terra di Lavore. Scritta del [!] R.P.F. Giacomo Milesio da Ponta Hibernese, di minori osservanti riformato, habitante nel regio convento della Croce di Palazzo di Napoli

title: Il forastiero. Dialogi di Giulio Cesare Capaccio Academico Otioso. Ne i quali, oltre a quel che si ragiona dell’origine di Napoli, governo antico [...]
information: It is a voluminous work by the well-known erudite and poet Giulio Cesare Capaccio (1552-1634), in which, in the form of a dialogue, an ideal Neapolitan citizen illustrates to an ideal 'foreigner' the antiquities and beauties of the city. It was printed in 1630, but was not distributed until 1634 with an 86-page appendix Incendio del Vesuvio, on the 1631 eruption.
summary: It is a voluminous work by the well-known erudite and poet Giulio Cesare Capaccio (1552-1634), in which, in the form of a dialogue, an ideal Neapolitan citizen illustrates to an ideal 'foreigner' the antiquities and beauties of the city. It was printed in 1630, but was not distributed until 1634 with an 86-page appendix Incendio del Vesuvio, on the 1631 eruption.
author: Capaccio, Giulio Cesare

title: Memorie della vita miracoli e culto di S. Gennaro martire vescovo di Benevento e principal protettore della città di Napoli
information: The work of the Neapolitan priest, erudite and politician Camillo Tutini (1594-1666) on the life, miracles and cult of St. Gennaro was triggered by the eruption of Vesuvius in 1631 (which is described in detail) and by the desire to illustrate the protection offered by the Saint to the city
summary: The work of the Neapolitan priest, erudite and politician Camillo Tutini (1594-1666) on the life, miracles and cult of St. Gennaro was triggered by the eruption of Vesuvius in 1631 (which is described in detail) and by the desire to illustrate the protection offered by the Saint to the city

title: Nuova, e vera relatione del terribile, e spaventoso terremoto successo nella città della Matrice, e suo stato, con patimento ancora di Accumulo, e luoghi circonuicini, sotto li 7 del presente mese di ottobre 1639
notes: Transcription of the text by CFTI5Med in https://storing.ingv.it/cfti/cfti5/pdf_T/003078-700109_T.pdf
information: After the first two tremors, which preceded the destructive event of 8 October, the population of Amatrice fled their homes, taking refuge partly in the open countryside and partly in the church of San Domenico, which did not collapse. Tents were set up to house the survivors and collective religious rites were celebrated.
summary: After the first two tremors, which preceded the destructive event of 8 October, the population of Amatrice fled their homes, taking refuge partly in the open countryside and partly in the church of San Domenico, which did not collapse. Tents were set up to house the survivors and collective religious rites were celebrated.
author: Tiberi, Carlo

title: Memorial de Fr. Francisco de la Torre Bohorques (OFM) sobre el terremoto de 1641 en Caracas
notes: It's in the manuscript Colección de documentos referentes a la historia eclesiástica y civil de América española, vol. 3, compiled by Juan Díez de la Calle. The Bohorques' printed text has no title. This is a modern attribution. It is placed on pages 203r-204v. In the text, the franciscan friar de la Torre Bohorques asks for economic aids to the King in order to rebuild the San Francisco convent. He giustifies his request on the grounds that there was no other religious order in Venezuela that taught Science or Grammar.'

title: Coronica de la religiosissima provincia de los doze / apostoles del Peru, de la orden de N.P. S. Francisco  de la regular / observancia [...]
notes:
On the death of some franciscans during the earthquake, see pp. 640-641.
On the ruin of San Francisco monastery and nuns from Santa Clara convent, see pp. 641 and 642.
On the guilty as the cause of the earthquake, see p. 641.
On the victims, see p. 641.
On the destruction of the cathedral, see p. 642.
On the destruction of archiepiscopal palace and Villarroel's miracle, see p. 642.
On the vision of the Augustinian nun from Concepción convent, see p. 642.
information: The friar narrates the death of some Franciscans during the earthquake that also caused the ruin of the monastery of San Francisco. The earthquake was a punishment for guilt and came at night without any warning, causing the death of more than a thousand people, the destruction of buildings and the ruin of animals.  Córdoba y Salinas also tells of the destruction of the cathedral of Santiago and the convent of the nuns of Santa Clara, under the rule of the Franciscans. Finally, he tells of the ruin of the archbishop's palace and the miraculous survival of Bishop Gaspar de Villarroel. The earthquake was foretold that same night by a nun from the Augustinian monastery who saw in the air a naked sword and a scourge threatening the city.
summary: The friar narrates the death of some Franciscans during the earthquake that also caused the ruin of the monastery of San Francisco. The earthquake was a punishment for guilt and came at night without any warning, causing the death of more than a thousand people, the destruction of buildings and the ruin of animals.  Córdoba y Salinas also tells of the destruction of the cathedral of Santiago and the convent of the nuns of Santa Clara, under the rule of the Franciscans. Finally, he tells of the ruin of the archbishop's palace and the miraculous survival of Bishop Gaspar de Villarroel. The earthquake was foretold that same night by a nun from the Augustinian monastery who saw in the air a naked sword and a scourge threatening the city.
author: Córdoba y Salinas, Diego de

title: Cronica de la provincia peruana de la orden de / los ermitaños de San Agustin Nuestro Padre [...]
information: On p. 23, Torres praises Bishop Villarroel's reconstruction of both the cathedral and the monastery of La Concepción, of Augustinian nuns.On pp. 37 and 39, there are references to the earthquake and its destructive effects on some buildings. On pp. 532-533, the author recounts the miraculous salvation of the Augustinian bishop Gaspar de Villarroel thanks to the intercession of St. Francisco Javier. He goes on to narrate the work of the bishop to attend to the material and spiritual needs of the faithful and to rebuild the cathedral. All this without having requested money from the king.

information: On pp. 644 and 645, Córdoba y Salinas reports on the duration of the earthquake and the emotions it provoked in the population. He describes the acts of public penitence carried out by the secular and ecclesiastical chapter and by the various religious orders. The earthquake is presented as one of the omens heralding the Last Judgement.

title: La estrella de Lima convertida en sol sobre sus tres coronas el B. Toribio Alfonso Mogrobexo su segundo arzobispo: celebrado con epitalamios sacros, y solembes cultos, por su esposa la santa iglesia metropolitana de Lima, al activo, y soberano influxo del ex.mo e ill.mo señor doct. D. Melchor de Liñán y Cisneros, obispo antes de las iglesias de Santa Marta, y Payán; presidente, governador, y capitán general del Nuevo Reyno de Granada, y visitador de su Real Audiencia; arçobispo de los Charcas, y actual arçobispo (octavo en orden) de la santa iglesia de Lima; Virrey, Governador, y capitán general, que ha sido de los reynos del Perú, Tierra-firme, y Chile. Descripción sacro política de las grandezas de la ciudad de Lima, y compendio histórico eclesiástico de su santa iglesia metropolitana: que descrive D. Francisco de Echave y Assu, cavallero del orden de Santiago, corregidor del Cercado de Lima por su magestad, y consagra a nuestro santíssimo, y beatíssimo Padre Innocencio XI

information: On pages 659-660, Torres narrates how, at the time his work was being printed, news had arrived from Chile of the earthquake and tsunami that had devastated the city of Concepcion and had also been felt in Santiago de Chile, where the cathedral collapsed. Few people died, only the most fragile, such as some old people and children. The tsunami ruined the royal storehouses where papers, weapons and supplies were kept. The tragedy was all the greater because it coincided with the rebellion of the Indians, which was put down by the Count of Alba, Viceroy of Peru, and by the governor.
summary: On pages 659-660, Torres narrates how, at the time his work was being printed, news had arrived from Chile of the earthquake and tsunami that had devastated the city of Concepcion and had also been felt in Santiago de Chile, where the cathedral collapsed. title: Istoria del monte Vesuvio divisata in due libri da d. Ignazio Sorrentino sacerdote secolare della Torre del Greco
information: The book is dedicated to Celestino Galiani, promoter of Newtonian and Lockian ideas in southern Italy. In the first chapters, the author analyses the minerals erupted by the volcano in 1631, illustrates the theory of Vesuvius' submarine origin and the different composition of the gases ejected. The second part opens with a description of the 1660 eruption, then moves on to the numerous eruptions occurred between 1682 and 1733, which Sorrentino observed in person, reporting personal notes and experiences. The 1682 eruption is described at pages 117-122
summary: The book is dedicated to Celestino Galiani, promoter of Newtonian and Lockian ideas in southern Italy. In the first chapters, the author analyses the minerals erupted by the volcano in 1631, illustrates the theory of Vesuvius' submarine origin and the different composition of the gases ejected. The second part opens with a description of the 1660 eruption, then moves on to the numerous eruptions occurred between 1682 and 1733, which Sorrentino observed in person, reporting personal notes and experiences. The 1682 eruption is described at pages 117-122
author: Sorrentino, Ignazio

title: Los estragos del temblor y subterranea conspiración. Las señales y que reynos son mas molestados de estos horrores. El resguardo, y remedio en lo humano, y en lo divino, lo compasivo en tales frangentes, de SS. pontífices, prelados, y príncipes en diversas edades con relación de algunas grandezas de esta ciudad; y reyno de Nápoles. Todo esto, en respuesta a una carta de un amigo del autor, compuesta en Nápoles por D. Anastasio marcelino Uberte Balaguer
author: Uberte Balaguer, Anastasio Marcelino

title: Llanto sagrado de la América Meridional, que busca alivio en los reales ojos de nuestro cathólico y siempre gran monarcha Señor D. Carlos segundo, rey de las Españas y emperador de las Indias
notes: La copia digitale precisata si tratta dell'edizione del testo di Romero realizzata da Gabriel Giraldo Jaramillo, Lima, Biblioteca Nacional del Perú, 1988. Anche se non fa riferimento esplicito al terremoto del 1687 assicura alla fine del trattato che tutte le calamità che ha sofferto e subisce l'America si devono alla punizione di Dio per gli attentati dei ministri regi alla Chiesa. Critica direttamente le gestioni del duca de la Palata.
author: Romero, Friar Francisco

title: Istoria del monte Vesuvio divisata in due libri da d. Ignazio Sorrentino sacerdote secolare della Torre del Greco
information: The book is dedicated to Celestino Galiani, promoter of Newtonian and Lockian ideas in southern Italy. In the first chapters, the author analyses the minerals erupted by the volcano in 1631, illustrates the theory of Vesuvius' submarine origin and the different composition of the gases ejected. The second part opens with a description of the 1660 eruption, then moves on to the numerous eruptions occurred between 1682 and 1733, which Sorrentino observed in person, reporting personal notes and experiences. The 1689 eruption is described at page 124
summary: The book is dedicated to Celestino Galiani, promoter of Newtonian and Lockian ideas in southern Italy. In the first chapters, the author analyses the minerals erupted by the volcano in 1631, illustrates the theory of Vesuvius' submarine origin and the different composition of the gases ejected. The second part opens with a description of the 1660 eruption, then moves on to the numerous eruptions occurred between 1682 and 1733, which Sorrentino observed in person, reporting personal notes and experiences. The 1689 eruption is described at page 124
author: Sorrentino, Ignazio

title: Istoria del monte Vesuvio divisata in due libri da d. Ignazio Sorrentino sacerdote secolare della Torre del Greco
information: The book is dedicated to Celestino Galiani, promoter of Newtonian and Lockian ideas in southern Italy. In the first chapters, the author analyses the minerals erupted by the volcano in 1631, illustrates the theory of Vesuvius' submarine origin and the different composition of the gases ejected. The second part opens with a description of the 1660 eruption, then moves on to the numerous eruptions occurred between 1682 and 1733, which Sorrentino observed in person, reporting personal notes and experiences. The 1707 eruption is described at pages 157-164
summary: The book is dedicated to Celestino Galiani, promoter of Newtonian and Lockian ideas in southern Italy. title: Nueva relación, en un curioso romance, en que se declaran las copiosas lluvias, y grandes inundaciones, que ha padecido la ciudad de Sevilla, y sus contornos, los barrios, arrabales, y casas, que han estado anegadas, y las copiosas limosnas, que han repartido a los pobres el cabildo de la Santa Metropolitana iglesia, el señor Arzobispo, el cabildo de la ciudad, el señor asistente, los padres de la Cartuja, la casa de la Misericordia, y otras muchas piadosas personas, como lo verá el curioso lector, este año de 1736
author: Unknown

title: Nueva, y verdadera relación, en un curioso romance, que da cuenta de una horrorosa tempestad de agua, truenos, relámpagos y rayos, que padeció esta muy noble y leal ciudad de Sevilla el día 23 de abril de este año de 1736 desde las siete hasta las diez de la noche. Refiérense los grandes estragos que hicieron los rayos en la magnífica portada del colegio seminario del Señor San Telmo, en el de San Alberto, y en el de San Miguel, y las ruinas que causaron en cada colegio, y referido convento como con toda individualidad lo verá el discreto lector
author: Unknown

title: Nueva relación, en curioso romance, en que se declaran las copiosas lluvias, y grandes inundaciones, que ha padecido la ciudad de Sevilla, y sus contorno, los barrios, arrabales, y casas, que han estado anegadas, y las copiosas limosnas que han repartido a los pobres el cabildo de la santa metropolitana iglesia, el señor arzobispo, el Cabildo de la ciudad, el señor asistente, los padres de la Cartuja, la Casa de la Misericordia, y otras muchas piadosas personas, como lo verá el curioso lector, este año de 1736
author: Unknown

title: Resumen verídico de la horrorosa tormenta de relámpagos, rayos, y centellas, que acaecieron en la ciudad de Sevilla la noche del día veinte y tres de abril de este año de mil setecientos y treinta y seis. Y asimismo de las solemnes Finciones, que en acción de gracias han celebrado el colegio, Rosario de Sr. S. Alberto, y el de la Nra. Sra. de la Merced, con unas fervorosas novenas, y plausibles fiestas; y quedándose esta divina señora en la iglesia, acuden convidados los rosarios de las parochias de esta ciudad, y lo demás que verá el curioso lector
author: Unknown

title: Verdadera relación de lo sucedido en la tormenta de truenos, relámpagos, centellas, y rayos, que vino sobre la ciudad de Sevilla en 23 de abril de este año de 1736 y de las fiestas que le hicieron a Maria Santíssima de la Merced, por los singulares favores, que visiblemente se le debieron en esta aflicción
author: Unknown

title: Escudo de armas de México. Celestial protección de esta nobilíssima ciudad, de la Nueva-España y de casi todo el Nuevo Mundo, María Santíssima en su portentosa imagen del mexicano Guadalupe, milagrosamente apparecida en el palacio arzobispal el año de 1531 y jurada su principal patrona el passado de 1737, en la angustia que ocasionó la pestilencia
author: Cabrera y Quintero, Cayetano

author: Unknown

title: Carta, o diario que escribe d. Joseph Eusebio de Llano y Zapata, a su más venerado amigo, y docto correspondiente, el doctor don Ignacio Chirivoga y Daza, canónigo de la santa iglesia de Quito, en que con la mayor verdad, y crítica más segura le da cuenta de todo lo acaecido en esta capital de el Perú, desde el viernes 28 de octubre de 1746, quando experimentó su mayor ruina, con el grande movimiento de tierra, que  nundac a las diez, y media de la noche del mencionado día, hasta 16 de febrero de 1747, con una tabla en que se da el cálculo exacto de todo el número de temblores, que se han sentido en el  nundac, sucesso, que es lastimoso assumpto de este escrito, y juntamente le participa el estrago del presidio del Callao, y sus habitadores, con la  nundación del mar, que los tragó en la noche del primer terremoto
author: Llano y Zapata, Joseph Eusebio

title: Noticia de una gran tempesta, que se origini en Valencia el día del corpus nueve de junio de 1746, entre seis, y siete de la tarde, al tiempo que la procesión iva en su mayor luzimiento, y estando la custodia del soberano sol de justicia en la plaza del Mercado. Como verá el curioso lector en el siguiente romance. Segundo romance, el qual declara más individualmente el daño que ocasionó la tempestad del día del corpus, en la ciudad de Valencia, en el año 1746
author: Unknown

Compuesto por un Ingenio de Medina-Sydonia

Tercera parte
author: Unknown

title: Nueva relación, en que se refieren los horrorosos estragos que ha causado en la ciudad de Lisboa, corte de Portugal, el terremoto del día primero de noviembre de ete año de 1755 con lo demás, que verá el curioso lector
author: Unknown

title: Especial protección que debió Sevilla a la Virgen Sma. de los Reyes, y a el Sr. S. Fernando en el formidable terremoto que experimentó el primer día de noviembre de este año de 1755
author: Unknown

title: Tercera parte en que se prosiguen las ruinas que han sucedido en la ciudad de Cádiz y en la de Xerez y en la villa de Conil y asimismo las rogativas con que pidiendo al cielo han procurado mitigar la justa Ira de Dios
author: Unknown

title: Relación succinta de el terremoto acaecido en la ciudad de Córdova, y lugares circunvecinos, el día primero de noviembre de 1755
author: Unknown

title: Lecciones entretenidas y curiosas physico- astrológico- meteorológicas sobre la generación, causas y señales de los terremotos y especialmente de las causas, señales y varios efectos del sucedido en España en el día primero de noviembre del passado de 1755, dedicadas al Señor D. Diego de Torres Villarroel
author: Ortiz Gallardo, Isidoro

title: Segunda parte del nunca visto conflito, que ha experimentado la gran Ciudad de Córdoba con el terremoto del día primero de noviembre del corriente de 1755 el que arruinó muchos de sus edificios, y principalmente la torre de la cathedral. Se declara haber padecido el mismo estrago la villa de Hornachuelos, la de Peña Flor (en la que el convento franciscano quedó todo quarteado, y el altar mayor sin poder servir), la de Palma, y la de Posadas, donde haviendo cogido una pared a un niño, le dexó ileso. Con otras noticias, que verá el discreto, y curioso lector
author: Unknown

title: Explicación phísico-mechánica de las causas del temblor de tierra, como constan de la doctrina del príncipe de los philósophos Aristóteles, dada por medio de la vena cava y sus leyes, cuyo auxilio quita el horror de sus abstractos
author: Cabrera, Miguel

title: Relación de los patronatos que tiene San Francisco de Borja en varios reynos, y ciudades de la christiandad contra los terremotos, y beneficios que con dichos patronatos recibieron sus habitadores sacada de varios autores
author: Unknown

title: Ecos lamentables y angustiados sollozos, que exalan los comprimidos corazones de los habitantes de la ciudad de Cádiz, por la ruina ocasionada por el terremoto y desenfreno del mar, que se experimentó el día primero de noviembre de este presente año de 1755, con exacta relación de las desgracias sucedidas
author: Unknown

title: Dolorosos threnos al fatal estrago, que en la península de España ocasionó el trágico sucesso de un lamentable terremoto , acaecido poco antes de las diez de la mañana día de todos santos primero de noviembre del presente año de 1755. Y se da incidente noticia de los daños que también hizo en los Reynos de Marruecos, Fez, y de otros continentes de África, como también de otros espantosos sucessos por los mismos tiempos , en varias partes del mundo acaecidos. Y por último se ponen los favorables remedios, que nos ha franqueado el piadoso cielo ,para precavernos, y librarnos de tan tremendos insultos, y de otras semejantes calamidades. Su autor el padre D.L.R.
author: Unknown

title: Verdadera relación que declara el voraz incendio desgracias y muertes que han sucedido del día 9 de agosto de este presente año de 1755 en la ciudad de Sevilla en triana y casas de dos maestros de Coheteros en la calle de castilla con la quema de tres casas y muerte de una mueger y tres hijos de dicho maestro, muerte de un oficial de dicho exercicio y otros que salieron heridos con todo lo demás que verá el curioso
author: Unknown

title: Relación, y observaciones phísicas-mathemáticas, y morales sobre el general terremoto, y la irrupción del mar del día primero de noviembre de este año de 1755, que comprehendió a la ciudad, y gran puerto de Sta. María, y a toda la costa, y tierra firme del Reyno de Andalucía. Es una carta que escrivió a la muy illustre, y Real Academia de las Buenas Letras de la ciudad de Sevilla. Don Juan Luis Roche, académico de erudición de la misma Real Academia, socio de la Real Sociedad de Ciencias de Sevilla, académico de la Real Academia Portopolitana, y residente en la ciudad, y gran puerto de Santa Maria, en el Gremio, y Universidad de Mareantes, y Cargadores a las Indias
author: Roche, Juan Luis

title: Extensa y completa relación de todo lo acaecido de estragos y muertes en el Reyno de Berbería en el passado terremoto como assimismo la voracidad del fuego que por 40 horas padeció la gran corte de Constantinopla la noche del 27 de septiembre de este año de 55 que por cartas de los padres misioneros de aquellas provincias, escriptas a los religiosos de esta ciudad, se ha participado como assimismo otras de la plaza de gibraltar como en ella se verá
author: Unknown

title: Puntual descripción del formidabile terremoto, que se experimentó el día primero de noviembre del año de 1755. Romance arte mayor, paraphrástica versión de la antecedente elegía

Sacado de las cartas, y relaciones auténticas de cada parage

title: Respuesta a la carta del il.mo y r.mo señor d. Fray Miguel de San Josef, obispo de Guadix y Baza, del Consejo de S. Mag. Sobre varios escritos a cerca del terremoto por el doct. d. information: There is a report which title is Breve compendio de las innumerables y lamentables ruínas, y lastimosos estragos, que a la violencia, y conjuración de todos cuatro Elementos, experimentó esta gran Ciudad, y Corte de Lisboa, el día primero de Noviembre de este año de 1755. Moreover, in this newspaper there is also reports from Seville (1755. 11. 03), Cádiz (1755. 11. 04), Huelva (1755. 11. 04/09) and Ayamonte (1755. 11. 02)  in which offer a Resumen de los estragos, que en algunas ciudades y pueblos de España ha causado el temblor de tierra del día primero de noviembre de este presente año

title: Primera parte. Lamentables noticias del daño que ha ocasionado la langosta que se ha introducido por Andaluzía, Murcia, Orihuela, y en Alicante, y lugares de la Mancha, Cierra de Arcaraz, y en lugares del Reyno de Valencia, como lo verá el discreto lector, en este presente año 1756. Segunda Parte. Lastimoso romance donde se declara el desgraciado fin que tuvo un desesperado hombre blasfemo, en la Cierra de Alcaraz, que por averle la langosta comido todos los trigos, y haverle dexado uno sin tocárselo, blasfemando contra Dios, fue, y le dio fuego, y la langosta se bolviá contra él, y le comió los hojos, y la carne, este año de 1756
author: Unknown

title: Extracto de la vida de S. Gregorio Ostiense, obispo y confessor, protector contra la plaga de la langosta, oruga, pulgón y demás nocivos insectos, sacada del Flos Sanctorum del Señor S. Benito, y del Acta Sanctorum del padre Daniel Papebrochio, y sus continuadores de la Compañía de Jesús. Tom.2. del Mes de Mayo día 9. Por el P. Luis de Valdivia de la Sanctisima Compañía, presidente de la Sagrada Theología en su colegio de los santos apostoles San Bartolomé y Santiago el Mayor de esta ciudad. Dalo a luz pública su hermano el doctor don Antonio de Valdivia y Vazquez; colegial que fue, del Real de Santa Cruz de la Fee, Imperial Universidad de Granada, canónigo que su santa metropolitana iglesia y examinador synodal de su Arzobispado, quien lo dedica al mismo sr. san Gregorio Ostiense

Brieve relatione del Terremoto occorso nella Calabria e della rovina fatta in molte Terre, e / Casali di essa Mercordì notte 5 di Novembre 1659 secondo gli avvisi venuti di colà
notes: Transcription of the text by CFTI5Med in https://storing.ingv.it/cfti/cfti5/pdf_T/003009-110130_T.pdf
information: An anonymous report printed in Palermo on the basis of news from places in Calabria, in which, among other things, there is information on the damage suffered by some places in the Ionian area that were not visited by de Marinis. The report states that this region is in constant danger because there are immense caverns that generate great exhalations that cause strong telluric tremors.  It should be noted that the author superimposes the logic of divine punishment on the natural explanation.
summary: An anonymous report printed in Palermo on the basis of news from places in Calabria, in which, among other things, there is information on the damage suffered by some places in the Ionian area that were not visited by de Marinis. The report states that this region is in constant danger because there are immense caverns that generate great exhalations that cause strong telluric tremors.  It should be noted that the author superimposes the logic of divine punishment on the natural explanation.

title: Relatione fatta a S. E. sopra li danni che hanno patito molte citta, terre, et casali nella Prouincia di Calabria ultra, per cagion del terremoto, che segui la notte delli 5. di nouembre 1659
notes: Transcription of the text by CFTI5Med in https://storing.ingv.it/cfti/cfti5/pdf_T/003009-145124_T.pdf
information: This is De Marinis' official report, presented to the Viceroy on his return from Calabria in March 1660 and published the following April. It provides detailed information on the victims and the damage suffered by buildings: not only important houses and palaces (churches, monasteries, convents, castles, baronial palaces), but also productive structures such as mills, oil mills, fulling mills. The text is also accompanied by precise data on the number of households in all the localities visited and on the fiscal situation of each Università, both as regards the treasury and the assignees.
summary: This is De Marinis' official report, presented to the Viceroy on his return from Calabria in March 1660 and published the following April. title: Copia di una lettera scritta da monsignor vescovo di Catanzaro in Calabria al M.R.P. Assistente d'Italia di S. Agostino in Roma in ragguaglio delli terremoti che sono stati in Calabria alli 6 di novembre 1659
notes: Text edited in L. Andronico, Una ignota memoria sul terremoto del 1659, in Archivio Storico per la Calabria e la Lucania', LXXI (2004), pp. 77-85, and republished in F. It then provides a list of the towns most affected by the earthquake.

title: Descripción verídica y nota a la letra de el nunca esperimentado día y lacrimosa confusión que padeció el Santo Monasterio de S. Gerónymo de Sevilla en el fiero, espantoso terremoto, que succedió en 1 de Noviembre de este presente año de 1755
Cronica del conuento di S. Domenico in Soriano dall anno 1510 fin'al 1664
writer: Lembo, Antonino (Friar of the Order of Preachers)
information: In the treatise, the Dominican father recalls how the 1659 earthquake was the first of the devastating earthquakes that traumatised Calabria to affect the convent of San Domenico. During this catastrophic event, however, the convent was almost entirely destroyed, as were the church and adjoining buildings: many decorative elements were damaged; nine monks and a lay servant died; unharmed, however, was the Sacred Image. Forced to live in wooden huts, the Dominicans of Soriano Calabro rebuilt their convent thanks to the help of the Viceroy of Naples and the favour of Pope Alexander VII.
dedicatee: Marini, Giovanni Battista (General Chapter of the Order of Preachers)
summary: In the treatise, the Dominican father recalls how the 1659 earthquake was the first of the devastating earthquakes that traumatised Calabria to affect the convent of San Domenico. information: In one of the chapters (Book IV, ch, II) of his geographical and historical work, the Jesuit describes in great detail and using his personal memories the eruption, the damage caused, the reaction of the population, the public penances and the role of the Jesuits in guiding the devotion of the population. The Jesuit praises the positive effects of that calamity, namely the repentance and change of life of many of the faithful

title: A true and exact relation of the late prodigious earthquake & eruption of Mount Aetna as it came in a letter from Naples by the Right Honorable the Earle of Winchilsea. Together with a more particular narrative of the same, as it is collected out of several relations sent out from Catania
author: Finch, Heneage

title: A true and exact relation of the late prodigious earthquake & eruption of Mount Aetna as it came in a letter from Naples by the Right Honorable the Earle of Winchilsea. Together with a more particular narrative of the same, as it is collected out of several relations sent out from Catania
notes:
The digitised image is from the University of Oklahoma's copy.

This edition contains:
- A letter wrote in Naples on the 27th April 1669 from Lord Heneage Finch Winchilsea to Charles II of England (whose original handwritten text is in: M.A.G. Everett, ed., Calendar of State Papers Domestic: Charles II, 1668-9, London, Longman & Roberts, 1894; cfr. Azzaro e Castelli 2013, p. 32);
- A particular narrative of the same, as it is collected out of severall sic relations sent from Catania (pp. 11-25), translation into English of P-1669-ET-0154;
- A later relation from Catania, bearing date the 27th of April, gives us this farther account viz. (pp. 26-30), translation into English of P-1669-ET-015D.

The London edition was the first one to be printed.

A transcription of the text is in Azzaro-Castelli 2013, pp. 145-149.
author: Finch, Heneage

title: A true and exact relation of the late prodigious earth-quake and eruption of Mount Ætna, or Monte-Gibello as it came in a letter written to His Majesty from Naples by the Right Honourable the Earl of Winchilsea, His Maiesties late ambassador at Constantinople, who in his return from thence visiting Catania in the island of Sicily was an eye-witness of that dreadfull spectacle. Together with a more particular narrative of the same as it is collected out of several relations sent from Catania. Published by authority.

(pp. 26-30), translation into English of P-1669-ET-015D.

Copia de carta escrita de la ciudad de Lisboa a un caballero de la villa y corte de Madrid en 28 de otubre deste año de 1680 en la qual se da cuenta de como se abrió un huracán por tres vezes a vista de todos, vomitando mucho fuego tres días consecutivos. Los truenos y relámpagos que se causaron, efectos grandes que dellos se siguieron, habiéndose visto caer una gran bestia de una nube, a quien siguieron muchos alentados caballeros, y viéndola pacer en los prados no pudo ser habida a las manos por más diligencias que hizieron y de como la cola era de tres colores, y lo que significan

information: The author, a direct testimony of the earthquake in Naples, stated that the only way to avert the risk of future catastrophes was to repent and turn to God's mercy. At the same time, he devoted his efforts to proving the 'natural' origin of such disasters and discouraged the proliferation of unfounded rumours, predictions and divinations in the capital of the Kingdom, thus distancing himself from astrological discourses.

The volume is embellished by an engraving and, in some editions, by a map of the Vesuvio region

title: Júbilos de Lima en la dedicación de su santa Iglesia Cathedral. Instaurada (en gran parte) de la ruina, que padeció con el terremoto de el año 1746. A esfuerzos de el activo zelo de le Excmo. señor D. Joseph Manso de Velasco, conde de Superunda
writer: Ruis Cano y Saénz Galiano, Francisco Antonio
author: Ruis Cano y Saénz Galiano, Francisco Antonio

title: Carta o diario que escribe D. Joseph Eusebio de Llano y Zapata a su más venerado amigo y docto correspondiente, el doctor don Ignacio Chirivoga y Daza, canónigo de la Santa Iglesia de Quito, en que con la mayor verdad y crítica más segura le da cuenta de todo lo acaecido en esta capital de el Perú, desde el viernes 28 de octubre de 1746, quando experimentó su mayor ruina, con el grande movimiento de la tierra, que padeció a las diez y media de la noche del mencionado día, hasta 16 de febrero de 1747, con una tabla en que se da el cálculo exacto de todo el número de temblores que se han sentido en el trágico sucesso que es lastimoso assumpto de este escrito. Y juntamente le participa el estrago del Presidio de Callao y sus habitadores, con la inundación del mar, que los trago en la noche del primer terremoto
author: Llano y Zapata, Joseph Eusebio

title: Oración panegyrica, que en la festividad de el glorioso patriarcha señor San Joseph y estreno de su templo, reedificado después de la ruina que ocassionó el terremoto de el año passado de 1746

title: Funesta relacion en que se declara, como aviendo sucedido un grande terremoto fue destruida la ciudad de Lima, corte y capital del Perù, en el año passado de 1746

Segunda relacion y tragico romance de el horroroso temblor de tierra, y tormenta de el mar, que ha padecido la imperial ciudad de Lima, : y su Puerto de el Cayado, en el reyno de las Indias; como el mar sobervio se tragò el puerto, y la mayor parte de la ciudad, muriendo en sus ruinas, y abogados mas de dos mil personas de todos estados durando veinte y quatro horas su tormenta, las riquezas, y navios que se han perdido, con lo demàs que verà el curioso. Sucediò el dia 28. de octubre de este antecedente año de mil setecientos y quareta sic y seis

title: Nueva relación en un curioso romance en que se declara la rigurosa tormenta que ha padecido la ciudad de Cádiz y su bahía, el número de navíos y muertos, y las grandes rogativas que han hecho para aplacar la justicia divina y las demás particularidades que verá el curioso lector. Sucedió en los días 15 y 16 de enero de este presente año de 1752

Verdadera relación que declara la gran tormenta de aire, agua, relámpagos, truenos, rayos y centellas que hubo en la gran Plaza de Orán y terremoto que duró seis minutos. Notíciase en ella las muertes, ruinas y desgracias que hubo a causa de los referidos acontecimientos el primero de noviembre de este año de 1755

Puntual relación, en que se da cuenta del terrible terremoto que en esta ciudad de Córdoba se experimentó el día primero de noviembre de este presente año de 1755. Refierese su duración espantosa, la consternación de todos, el estrago hecho en los edificios arruinados, y maltratados, el raro prodigio de no haber perecido alguno entre confusión y ruinas tantas, debido a la singular protección del Santo Archangel Raphael sobre esta su ciudad, y le exhorta a todos a dar a Dios y a su Santo Archangel las debidas gracias, especialmente con una estable verdadera mudanza de costumbres

Nuevo y curioso romance del estrago causado el día de Todos Santos en la Villa de Huelva. Declárase como reventó la mar y el río, pereciendo más de dos mil personas, arruinados los templos y las casas, y assistiendo los pocos vecinos que han quedado en chozas, dando noticia como cayendo en el Convento de la Victoria parte de su templo y altar mayor, entre sus ruinas se encontró el sagrario todo rompido, menos el segrado copon, que lo cubría milagrosamente un medio ladrillo, con otras particularidades. Año de 1755

Nuevo y curioso romance del estrago causado el día de Todos Santos en la Villa de Huelva. Declárase como reventó la mar y el río, pereciendo más de dos mil personas, arruinados los templos y las casas, y assistiendo los pocos vecinos que han quedado en chozas, dando noticia como cayendo en el Convento de la Victoria parte de su templo y altar mayor, entre sus ruinas se encontró el sagrario todo rompido, menos el segrado copon, que lo cubría milagrosamente un medio ladrillo, con otras particularidades. Año de 1755
El desengaño a la presumptuosa ignorancia, que intenta persuadir efecto de los elementos los estragos del terremoto, distrayendo la compunción de los timoratos. Canto trágico
author: de la Cruz, Francisco Ignacio

title: Últimos avisos. Relación sobre el terremoto de el día de Todos Santos del presente año de 1755

Trágica relación y verdadero lastimoso romance en que se declara y expecifica el impensado y formidable temblor de tierra que se experimentó entre diez y once de la mañana del día primero de noviembre del presente año de 1755 en la imperial y coronada villa de Madrid. Refiérese la commoción general que hizo en todos los templos, casas y edificios, los grandes estragos, ruinas, perdidas, heridas y muertes que ocasionó, junto con el temor, susto y sobresalto universal de los vecinos, hombres, mugeres, niños, ancianos y varias noticiosas individualidades

Verdadera relación que después de referir los estragos causados el día de todos santos, da quenta de las lágrimas que lloró María Santísima del Rosario, venerada en la ciudad de Moguer, y del nuevo baile del terremoto que se ha introducido en esta ciudad, con poco respeto de la Magestad Divina, al aviso que nos ha dado. Se declara el caso especial que sucedió a una señora que habiendo ido a calle Francos por un abanico del temblor, y llegando a casa de un mercader a pedir dicho abanico, la respondió que sí tenía, y le sacó un crucifixo, diciendo: ¿es este el abanico que vmd quería? y la señora, con verguenza del hecho, cayó desmayada de la respuesta, y lo demás que verá el curioso lector

Nueva relación y curioso romance en que se declara el más lastimoso successo que ha sucedido en la ciudad de Cadiz donde se cuenta por extenso el grande estruendo y tragedias que han ocasionado el temblor de tierra y tormenta del mar, con muchas muertes repentinas, como lo verá el curioso lector. Sucedío en este presente año de 1755 el día 1 de noviembre

Afectos / reconocidos, que la sevillana devoción consagra reverente a la soberana / emperatriz del cielo, en el milagroso hermosíssimo simulachro, que con el / titulo del amparo se venera en la parochial de Santa Maria Magdalena, con el / fundado pensamiento de haver conseguido, que el Señor, mitigando su Justicia, / huviesse usado de su gran Misericordia, en el horroroso Terremoto del día / primero de Noviembre del año próximo passado de 1755 mediante el Patrocinio, e / intercessión, con que la Señora acreditó tan glorioso Título, exercitando su / Amparo desde aquel día, en que dio principio su annual novena. Sácalo a luz su / misma venerable hermandad quien lo dedica a la Señora en las siguientes décimas

La más sagrada Judith defensora de su pueblo: sermón panegyrico moral, predicado en una de las solemníssimas Fiestas, que a María Santíssima del Valle, conducida desde su templo extramuros a la insigne parrochial mayor de Santa Cruz de la ciudad de Ézija el dia 25 de noviembre, se le consagró en acción de gracias, por la preservación de mayores estragos justamente temidos en el formidable terremoto, acaecido el día primero de noviembre de este presente año de 1755

title: De conflagratione Agri Puteolani, Simonis portii
information: Simone Porzio's essay offered an Aristotelian interpretation of natural disasters. This peripatetic view became the official account of the disaster and emphasized the role of subterranean winds, linked to celestial movements, in causing earthquakes. Despite the infrequency of eruptions and earthquakes, both were considered inherent to nature. The essay provided a general reflection on earthquake causes and then outlined the events that led to the formation of Monte Nuovo.
dedicatee: Toledo, Pedro Álvarez y Zúñiga (Viceroy of Naples)

title: De Puteolani aeris natura
information: This text is the Latin version of the 'Ragionamento, del terremoto, del nuouo monte' by the same author.Pietro Giacomo de Toledo, a witness to the 1538 eruption, authored a work explaining the disaster and dedicated to the Viceroy. This text, presented as a dialogue between Peregrino and Suessano, used Aristotelian concepts to describe the eruption's causes and effects. The dialogue explained the eruption through a metaphor based on the workings of the human body. Toledo emphasized two origins in seismic activity, a final cause (God) and a formal cause (resulting from terrestrial movements). He also discussed subterranean winds generating earthquakes in regions without openings. Toledo's outlook for the near future was pessimistic, especially for Pozzuoli.
dedicatee: Toledo, Pedro Álvarez y Zúñiga (Viceroy of Naples)

information: Printed version of the contents of the letter that Francesco Del Nero, a witness to the 1538 eruption, wrote to Niccolò del Benino, giving a vivid account of the impact of the disaster. Del Nero, a Florentine businessman and relative of Machiavelli, described the transformation of the once enchanting Pozzuoli into a fiery nightmare. He also expressed his inability to comprehend the immense volume of incandescent materials ejected from the crater in just two days.Del Nero mentioned the scholarly discussions surrounding the event, acknowledging the writings of Simone Porzio and the viceroy Pedro de Toledo's response, which involved digging numerous deep pits to extinguish the fire. Del Nero's letter reflects the popular perception of the eruption during his time.Del Nero compared the eruption to a pyrotechnic display at Castel Sant'Angelo, like the one held to celebrate the marriage between Margaret, daughter of Emperor Charles V, and Ottavio Farnese in November 1538, the month after the date of the letter.
summary: Printed version of the contents of the letter that Francesco Del Nero, a witness to the 1538 eruption, wrote to Niccolò del Benino, giving a vivid account of the impact of the disaster. Del Nero, a Florentine businessman and relative of Machiavelli, described the transformation of the once enchanting Pozzuoli into a fiery nightmare. He also expressed his inability to comprehend the immense volume of incandescent materials ejected from the crater in just two days.Del Nero mentioned the scholarly discussions surrounding the event, acknowledging the writings of Simone Porzio and the viceroy Pedro de Toledo's response, which involved digging numerous deep pits to extinguish the fire. Del Nero's letter reflects the popular perception of the eruption during his time.Del Nero compared the eruption to a pyrotechnic display at Castel Sant'Angelo, like the one held to celebrate the marriage between Margaret, daughter of Emperor Charles V, and Ottavio Farnese in November 1538, the month after the date of the letter.

information: Naudè's Discours on Vesuvio is the publication of the correspondence with which the author informed one of his Parisian interlocutors about the event. The text does not offer original insights from a scientific point of view, but against the naturalistic background the author emphasises the need for caution in historical reporting, criticism of superstitions and clichés, fear of political upheaval and hints of irritation with religion.

title: Storia, grandezze, e miracoli di Maria Vergine del Santissimo Rosario / secondo il corso delle Domeniche, e Feste di tutto l’Anno

title: Esercizi / di pietà per tutti i giorni dell’anno, che contengono l ' Esplicazione del / Mistero, ovvero la Vita del Santo onorato in quel giorno, con più Riflessioni / sopra la Pistola, una Meditazione sopra il Vangelo della Messa, e molte / Pratiche di Pietà per ogni sorta di Persone
information: Re-enactment of the saving role of San Gennaro during the eruption of Vesuvio in 1631.

title: Pascoli / sacri di monsignor D. Domenico Diez de Aux vescovo di Gerace
information: Re-enactment of the recent eruption of Vesuvio, caused above all by bad justice.
summary: Re-enactment of the recent eruption of Vesuvio, caused above all by bad justice.

title: Ristretto / della vita, virtù, e miracoli del Ven. Servo di Dio Fr. Martino Porres / Terziario Professo dell’Ordine del Glorioso Patriarca S. Domenico compilato dal / molto Rev. Padre Maestro Fra Domenico Ponsi del medesimo Ordine
information: Martino Porres stops the flooding of the Rìmac river near Lima by throwing three stones into it.
summary: Martino Porres stops the flooding of the Rìmac river near Lima by throwing three stones into it.

title: Breve relatione fatta dal Consigliere Hettorre Capecelatro, Delegato per / l’Illustriss. &t; Eccellentiss. Sig. Duca di Medina de las Torres, e di Sabioneta, Principe di / Stigliano, &tc.; Viceré, Luogotenente, e Capitan Generale in questo Regno di Napoli, e suo / Collateral Consiglio: à rivedere i danni nelle Provincie di Calavria, cagionati dal terremoto / succeduto a 27 di Marzo 1638 per applicarci i remedij necessarij, per la sollevatione di quelle / Città, Terre, e Castelli, che hanno patito
notes: Transcription of the text by CFTI5Med in https://storing.ingv.it/cfti/cfti5/pdf_T/000107-770415_T.pdf
information: The report provides information on about 200 towns and villages. For each locality, the number of dead, distinguished by gender and age group, the number of buildings destroyed or severely damaged, with a focus on the most important buildings (churches, castles, monasteries, city walls, convents, noble residences), and a concise qualitative commentary on the general condition of the place, are given.
summary: The report provides information on about 200 towns and villages. For each locality, the number of dead, distinguished by gender and age group, the number of buildings destroyed or severely damaged, with a focus on the most important buildings (churches, castles, monasteries, city walls, convents, noble residences), and a concise qualitative commentary on the general condition of the place, are given.
author: Capecelatro, Ettore (Viceroy Delegate)

title: Mundus subterraneus
notes: Transcription of the text by CFTI5Med in https://storing.ingv.it/cfti/cfti5/pdf_T/000107-110106_T.pdf
information: The famous German scholar and naturalist Athanasius Kircher, who was sailing along the Tyrrhenian coast of Calabria during the days of the earthquake and was able to directly observe the effects of the earthquake in Sant'Eufemia and other coastal towns, provides valuable testimony.
summary: The famous German scholar and naturalist Athanasius Kircher, who was sailing along the Tyrrhenian coast of Calabria during the days of the earthquake and was able to directly observe the effects of the earthquake in Sant'Eufemia and other coastal towns, provides valuable testimony.
author: Kircher, Athanasius

title: Copia di una lettera scritta dal prior di Soriano delle stelle apparse in quell'imagine nel tempo del terremoto
notes: Transcription of the text by CFTI5Med in https://storing.ingv.it/cfti/cfti5/pdf_T/000107-560171_T.pdf
dedicatee: Padula, Domenico della (Father Procurator of San Domenico)
author: Di Castelvetere, Francesco

title: Relation véritable des estranges et prodigieux effets d'un tremblement de terre, arrivé dans la Calabre, Province de l'Italie, sur la fin du mois de mars dernier passé, par lequel plusieurs villes, bourgs et villages ont esté englouties ou abbatues, avec perte de plus de cent mille personnes

Vero racconto del seguito terremoto nella Calabria inferiore sotto li 27 di marzo 1638 che tra le 21 & 22 hore seguì con spavento e ruina di molte città, castelli, & terrore e mortalità di cinquautamilla (sic!) persone in circa
notes: The digitised image is from the Wien copy.

title: Ebdomada panegirica rappresentante le pompe supreme dell’Ordine de’ / Predicatori
information: The preacher recalls the protection exercised by Saint Dominic towards the city of Soriano during a strong earthquake.
summary: The preacher recalls the protection exercised by Saint Dominic towards the city of Soriano during a strong earthquake.
author: Manfredi, Antonio

title: Santo Domingo de Soriano milagroso y aplaudido
dedicatee: Fernández Manrique de Lara, Juan Luis
author: Gómez, Francisco

title: Copia de una carta, que el Padre Prior del Convento de Santo Domingo de Soriano, escrivió al Reverendíssimo General de la Orden de Predicadores, a Roma, acerca de un Milagro notable, que en la villa de Soriano obró Dios nuestro Señor por nuestro Padre Santo Domingo, y aquella Imagen, en la ocasión de los espantosos temblores y terremotos, que entonces huvo en Italia, en este año de 1638. La qual remitió el muy Reverendo Padre Provincial de Anglia, Compañero del Reverendíssimo General, al Convento de Santo Domingo el Real de la villa de Madrid
author: Di Castelvetere, Francesco

title: Raccolta / de’ miracoli di S. Domenico in Soriano
information: Miracle performed by San Domenico during an earthquake that occurred in Calabria in 1638.
